text: 1. Adjust oven rack to upper middle position and preheat oven to 375F (190C). In a large baking dish, combine potatoes, rosemary, and 2 tablespoons (30ml) olive oil. Set baking dish aside to cool; keep oven on.

text: 1. Preheat oven to 400F (200C). Cut about half the squash into 1-inch chunks, to yield 4 cups. Cut remaining squash into 1/4-inch dice. In a large mixing bowl, toss large squash chunks with 2 tablespoons (30ml) olive oil, garlic, apple, red pepper flakes, sage sprigs, and a large pinch of salt until evenly coated, then spread in an even layer on a rimmed baking sheet. In a separate bowl, toss small diced squash with 2 tablespoons (30ml) olive oil, maple syrup, and a pinch of salt, then spread in an even layer on a second rimmed baking sheet.

query: what am I preheating the oven to?
text: 1. Preheat oven to 400F (200C). Cut about half the squash into 1-inch chunks, to yield 4 cups. Cut remaining squash into 1/4-inch dice. In a large mixing bowl, toss large squash chunks with 2 tablespoons (30ml) olive oil, garlic, apple, red pepper flakes, sage sprigs, and a large pinch of salt until evenly coated, then spread in an even layer on a rimmed baking sheet. In a separate bowl, toss small diced squash with 2 tablespoons (30ml) olive oil, maple syrup, and a pinch of salt, then spread in an even layer on a second rimmed baking sheet.

In this recipe, how can I flavor the squash? toss large squash chunks with 2 tablespoons (30ml) olive oil, garlic, apple, red pepper flakes, sage sprigs, and a large pinch of salt. Toss small diced squash with 2 tablespoons (30ml) olive oil, maple syrup, and a pinch of salt. how many tablespoons of olive oil again? 2 tablespoons (30ml) should I cut the sage? sage What am I supposed to do while the different trays are baking? Stirring once or twice during baking how long should I cook it for? about 45 minutes how long am I cooking the small chunks for? about 30 minutes Done. What's next? Discard sage sprigs from large squash chunks. do I need to take the sage out of the large chunks of squash tray? yes what am I doing with the mixture next? food processor, blender okay Alexa what am I putting in the food processor? large squash chunks, apple, and garlic cloves How should I proceed after placing the squash, apple, and garlic into the food processor? Add miso and 1/4 cup (60ml) broth and blend until a smooth pure forms. What do I do once I have the puree ready? Season with salt. what should I season it with? salt what should I do with the olive oil? heat i've put the olive oil in a pressure cooker what what heat do I need to have it on? medium-high heat What should I do next with the onions after heating the olive oil? Add onion and cook, stirring, until translucent but not browned, about 4 minutes. what am I adding to the pressure cooker do I need to add something? onion so I have put the rice in what do I want to be coated in oil? rice okay Alexa how long am I cooking the Rice for? 4 minutes right what am I putting in next? rice How can I tell if the rice is toasted properly? Rice grains should start to look like tiny ice cubes: translucent around the edges and cloudy in the center. what smell am I looking for? raw alcohol what do I add next? wine how long do I cook it for? about 2 minutes How will I know when to stop cooking the wine? until raw alcohol smell has cooked off and wine has almost fully evaporated What should I do after adding the remaining broth? Scrape any grains of rice or pieces of onion from side of pressure cooker so that they are fully submerged. Close pressure cooker and bring up to low pressure (10 psi on most units). what else am I scraping? onion what am I scraping? rice I'm putting in 840 milliliters of what? <extra_id_0> 7. Stir in remaining 3 1/2 cups (840ml) broth; scrape any grains of rice or pieces of onion from side of pressure cooker so that they are fully submerged. Close pressure cooker and bring up to low pressure (10 psi on most units). Cook at low pressure for 5 minutes, then depressurize cooker either by running it under cold water if it is not electric, or using the steam-release valve if it is electric.

text: 8. Meanwhile, in a small saucepan, melt butter over medium-high heat until foaming subsides, 2 to 3 minutes. Add remaining 8 sage leaves and fry, gently swirling, until milk solids in butter turn a hazelnut-brown color, 1 to 2 minutes longer. Remove from heat. Using a slotted spoon, transfer sage leaves to a paper towellined plate.

query: what am I preheating the oven to? to 400f How should I prepare the squash for this step? Cut about half the squash into 1-inch chunks, to yield 4 cups. Cut remaining squash into 1/4-inch dice. In this recipe, how can I flavor the squash? toss large squash chunks with 2 tablespoons (30ml) olive oil, garlic, apple, red pepper flakes, sage sprigs, and a large pinch of salt. Toss small diced squash with 2 tablespoons (30ml) olive oil, maple syrup, and a pinch of salt. how many tablespoons of olive oil again?
text: 1. Preheat oven to 400F (200C). Cut about half the squash into 1-inch chunks, to yield 4 cups. Cut remaining squash into 1/4-inch dice. In a large mixing bowl, toss large squash chunks with 2 tablespoons (30ml) olive oil, garlic, apple, red pepper flakes, sage sprigs, and a large pinch of salt until evenly coated, then spread in an even layer on a rimmed baking sheet. In a separate bowl, toss small diced squash with 2 tablespoons (30ml) olive oil, maple syrup, and a pinch of salt, then spread in an even layer on a second rimmed baking sheet.

text: 2. In a 12-inch skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat until shimmering. text: 1. Season quail all over with salt. In a large cast iron skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat until shimmering. Add quail. If quail are spatchcocked, cook them skin side down until well browned, about 5 minutes, then flip and cook other side until desired doneness is reached (quail can be served from medium-rare to well done, as desired; they are too small to accurately use a thermometer, so feel free to cut into the meat to check doneness). If using deboned quail, cook on both sides, turning frequently, until browned on both sides and desired doneness is reach, about 4 minutes per side for medium.

text: 11. Set loaf pan on middle rack of oven and slide a rimmed baking sheet on the rack underneath to catch any drips. Bake until top is golden brown and domed and a cake tester or toothpick inserted into the center meets little resistance and comes out clean, 65 to 75 minutes; rotate pan one time halfway through baking. Transfer cake to wire rack and cool for 10 minutes; loosen sides with butter knife or offset spatula. Cool cake in pan to about 140F (60C), about 2 hours. Then lift loaf using overhanging parchment and transfer to a cutting board. Let cake cool completely before slicing, about 1 hour longer.

query: What's the first step if I'm using instant or fresh yeast? If using instant or fresh yeast, combine flour and all of the water in a stand mixer fitted with the dough hook. what else do I mix in with the yeast? flour and all of the water what type of raising agent is best? fresh yeast How should I mix these (salt and yeast) ingredients into the dough? Mix at low speed or by hand until salt and yeast are fully incorporated and dough is smooth. How can I determine if the dough is ready for the next step? Until salt and yeast are fully incorporated and dough is smooth. do I need any seasoning? salt do I mix it by hand? mixer how long do I have to mix everything for? about 3-5 minutes What is the indication that the dough has been adequately mixed? the dough feels elastic and bounces partway back when indented with your thumb What should I do after I transfer the dough to the mixing bowl? cover with plastic wrap. Let dough stand at room temperature for 30 minutes. How can I prevent tearing the dough surface when transferring? Working with oiled hands, gently transfer dough. what do I put the dough into?
text: 4. Working with oiled hands, gently transfer dough, being careful not to tear its surface, to a lightly oiled mixing bowl and cover with plastic wrap. Let dough stand at room temperature for 30 minutes. Uncover dough. Working with wet hands and/or a plastic bench scraper, loosen the dough, then gently lift and pull the dough down towards you, folding it in half. Give the bowl a quarter turn and repeat, folding the dough in half towards you. Now give the bowl a half turn and repeat the fold a final time, being careful not to compress it too much. Lastly, pull the unfolded side of your dough carefully up from the bottom, and pull it up and over to form a neat package. Re-cover with plastic wrap and let stand until dough has increased in volume by half, about 1 hour 30 minutes longer.

query: What's the first step if I'm using instant or fresh yeast? If using instant or fresh yeast, combine flour and all of the water in a stand mixer fitted with the dough hook. what else do I mix in with the yeast?
text: 1. If using instant or fresh yeast, combine flour and all of the water in a stand mixer fitted with the dough hook. If using active dry yeast, combine flour with 650g water and combine yeast with 50g warm water; let yeast stand until foamy. Mix flour and water at low speed until they are fully incorporated and form a uniform dough. Alternatively, combine flour and water in a mixing bowl and mix using a dough spatula until dough forms. Cover the bowl with a kitchen towel or plastic wrap and let the dough rest for at least 15 minutes and up to 1 hour.

Reserve rehydrated mushrooms and 1/4 cup (60ml) soaking liquid, making sure to dispose of any grit that has settled at the bottom. what is a slotted spoon? <no_answer> how many mushrooms are needed? 1 1/2 ounces (40g) what type of cup is needed? <no_answer> how many grams is in 1 tbsp? <no_answer> how much garlic is needed? <extra_id_0> 2. In a 5-quart pot, combine 1/4 cup (60ml) olive oil, garlic, pepper flakes, and 1 tablespoon minced parsley. Set over medium heat and cook, stirring frequently, until very fragrant and garlic is just beginning to turn the lightest shade of gold, about 3 minutes.
